Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer breached procedural fairness by not allowing the applicant to address insufficient information and whether the applicant is entitled to reconsideration
Evidence_Assessment: Application lacked required details such as salary and duties; additional information was submitted post-refusal
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to demonstrate procedural unfairness or error
Legal_Rule: Under subsection 75(3) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, if an applicant fails to meet requirements, their application shall be refused with no further assessment
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to provide opportunity to respond to deficiencies
Review_Standard: Compliance with procedural fairness and regulatory requirements
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach found; officers not required to solicit explanations for deficient applications
Key_Evidence_Considered: Missing salary and job duties in application, post-refusal submissions
Legal_Framework: Federal Courts Act, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Applicant_Challenge: Lack of procedural fairness and entitlement to reconsideration
Legal_Rule_Source: Subsection 75(3), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Defendant_Response: Application was incomplete per regulatory requirements; no duty to reassess after refusal
Legal_Provision: Subsection 75(3), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 75(3) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Applicable_Process: Visa application and judicial review process
Governing_Rule: Subsection 75(3), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
